channel.title: CVE Feed for Reservation Diary -- ReDi Restaurant Reservation
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Reservation Diary -- ReDi Restaurant Reservation

item.title: CVE-2021-24299|2024-08-03T19:28:23.396Z -- reservation%20diary -- redi%20restaurant%20reservation
item.description: The ReDi Restaurant Reservation WordPress plugin before 21.0426 provides the functionality to let users make restaurant reservations. These reservations are stored and can be listed on an 'Upcoming' page provided by the plugin. An unauthenticated user can fill in the form to make a restaurant reservation. The form to make a restaurant reservation field called 'Comment' does not use proper input validation and can be used to store XSS payloads. The XSS payloads will be executed when the plugin user goes to the 'Upcoming' page, which is an external website https://upcoming.reservationdiary.eu/ loaded in an iframe, and the stored reservation with XSS payload is loaded.

item.title: CVE-2024-29806|2024-08-02T01:17:57.614Z -- reservation%20diary -- redi%20restaurant%20reservation
item.description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in Reservation Diary ReDi Restaurant Reservation allows Reflected XSS.This issue affects ReDi Restaurant Reservation: from n/a through 24.0128.

item.title: CVE-2024-31299|2024-07-06T02:51:01.696Z -- reservation%20diary -- redi%20restaurant%20reservation
item.description: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in Reservation Diary ReDi Restaurant Reservation allows Cross-Site Scripting (XSS).This issue affects ReDi Restaurant Reservation: from n/a through 24.0128.
